Jay Leno's a good man or seems like he is anyway...

I talked with him a couple times,

once at Pebble Beach, D'Elegance I was just spectating

he had an AC Cobra (or was it a AC Bristol) & a GT40 there IIRC,

special year for Shelby's stuff, like a 10-12 (?) or so years ago

& another time at Bob's Big Boy in Burbank Ca,

he had his silver/black 55 (?) Buick Centry, with a 572 BBC in it,

there IIRC

he seemed like he was a down to earth, laid back, normal nice guy

that didn't come off 'stuck up or like he had lots of $$',

laughing & having a great time with other car guys

& he has some very cool cars...

Dementia is a tough one. We tried to look after my mom in our house for two and a half years. You can’t, simple as that.

We’re doing that now. She’s 82 in early stages, not eating, drinking her Chardonnay wine like a fish and refuses all doctor care, refuses to go anywhere and we’ve tried to get her help but she is still sharp enough that she answers everything correctly and convinces them she’s fine. I get the pride thing! But it’s rough for all that have had to deal with this sort of thing and those that will. Sucks.
